Quick Facts

EXIT   X

KYC OBLIGATIONS

Page

Table of Contents

 

Reporting entities have record-keeping obligations.

 

Records can be originals or copies of actual hardcopy documents. They may also be electronically retained.

 

Click on the terms below for more details

Any records on providing a designated service to a specific customer must be kept for seven years. Documents provided by a customer must also be kept for seven years after the giving of the document.

Every time an identification procedure is carried out for a customer, you must make a record of the procedure and any information found out when carrying out the procedure. Your organisation meets this obligation if a customer gives you a document that satisfies the customer identification procedure and it has been copied.

 

These records must be kept for seven years after the last designated service was provided to the customer.

Your organisation must give transaction records if it is an authorised deposit-taking institution (ADI) transferring the account to another ADI. This must be done within 120 days, and 30 days before the transfer of the account.
